page.title: 05Wootton Church
page.content: St.Mary's church is early 14th century,although there was a former church on the site.The church of Wootton was bestowed on Newnham Priory by Simon de Beauchamp in his foundation charter of 1166.The oldest parts of the church are arches which date from 1310.The church was said to have been situated in a wood,but now there are only one or two trees around it.To the north of the church is a coffin lid with a beautifully carved 14th century cross.The south porch is a later addition.The upper part of the tower is early 15th century work,as is the tracery inserted in several windows.The lower part of the tower has been largely rebuilt.The north and south walls of the chancel have been refaced.The tiled roof is modern.The nave and aisles have embattled parapets.
